00143 #if 0
00144 /* A structure, representing the lattice range of statmodel parameters.
00145    It is used for optimizing statmodel parameters by cross-validation method.
00146    The lattice is logarithmic, so <step> must be greater then 1. */
00147 typedef struct CvParamLattice
00148 {
00149     double min_val;
00150     double max_val;
00151     double step;
00152 }
00153 CvParamLattice;
00154 
00155 CV_INLINE CvParamLattice cvParamLattice( double min_val, double max_val,
00156                                          double log_step )
00157 {
00158     CvParamLattice pl;
00159     pl.min_val = MIN( min_val, max_val );
00160     pl.max_val = MAX( min_val, max_val );
00161     pl.step = MAX( log_step, 1. );
00162     return pl;
00163 }
00164 
00165 CV_INLINE CvParamLattice cvDefaultParamLattice( void )
00166 {
00167     CvParamLattice pl = {0,0,0};
00168     return pl;
00169 }
00170 #endif

00212 /* The structure, representing the grid range of statmodel parameters.

00219 struct CV_EXPORTS CvParamGrid
00220 {
00221     // SVM params type
00222     enum { SVM_C=0, SVM_GAMMA=1, SVM_P=2, SVM_NU=3, SVM_COEF=4, SVM_DEGREE=5 };
00223 
00224     CvParamGrid()
00225     {
00226         min_val = max_val = step = 0;
00227     }
00228 
00229     CvParamGrid( double _min_val, double _max_val, double log_step )
00230     {
00231         min_val = _min_val;
00232         max_val = _max_val;
00233         step = log_step;
00234     }
00235     //CvParamGrid( int param_id );
00236     bool check() const;
00237 
00238     double min_val;
00239     double max_val;
00240     double step;
00241 };

00346 // SVM training parameters
00347 struct CV_EXPORTS CvSVMParams
00348 {
00349     CvSVMParams();
00350     CvSVMParams( int _svm_type, int _kernel_type,
00351                  double _degree, double _gamma, double _coef0,
00352                  double _C, double _nu, double _p,
00353                  CvMat* _class_weights, CvTermCriteria _term_crit );
00354 
00355     int         svm_type;
00356     int         kernel_type;
00357     double      degree; // for poly
00358     double      gamma;  // for poly/rbf/sigmoid
00359     double      coef0;  // for poly/sigmoid
00360 
00361     double      C;  // for CV_SVM_C_SVC, CV_SVM_EPS_SVR and CV_SVM_NU_SVR
00362     double      nu; // for CV_SVM_NU_SVC, CV_SVM_ONE_CLASS, and CV_SVM_NU_SVR
00363     double      p; // for CV_SVM_EPS_SVR
00364     CvMat*      class_weights; // for CV_SVM_C_SVC
00365     CvTermCriteria term_crit; // termination criteria
00366 };

00370 {

00372                                        const float* another, float* results );

00376     virtual ~CvSVMKernel();
00377 
00378     virtual void clear();

00380 
00381     const CvSVMParams* params;
00382     Calc calc_func;
00383 
00384     virtual void calc_non_rbf_base( int vec_count, int vec_size, const float** vecs,
00385                                     const float* another, float* results,
00386                                     double alpha, double beta );
00387 
00388     virtual void calc_linear( int vec_count, int vec_size, const float** vecs,
00389                               const float* another, float* results );
00390     virtual void calc_rbf( int vec_count, int vec_size, const float** vecs,
00391                            const float* another, float* results );
00392     virtual void calc_poly( int vec_count, int vec_size, const float** vecs,
00393                             const float* another, float* results );
00394     virtual void calc_sigmoid( int vec_count, int vec_size, const float** vecs,
00395                                const float* another, float* results );
00396 };

00509 // SVM model
00510 class CV_EXPORTS CvSVM : public CvStatModel
00511 {
00512 public:
00513     // SVM type
00514     enum { C_SVC=100, NU_SVC=101, ONE_CLASS=102, EPS_SVR=103, NU_SVR=104 };
00515 
00516     // SVM kernel type
00517     enum { LINEAR=0, POLY=1, RBF=2, SIGMOID=3 };
00518 
00519     // SVM params type
00520     enum { C=0, GAMMA=1, P=2, NU=3, COEF=4, DEGREE=5 };
00521 
00522     CvSVM();
00523     virtual ~CvSVM();
00524 
00525     CvSVM( const CvMat* _train_data, const CvMat* _responses,
00526            const CvMat* _var_idx=0, const CvMat* _sample_idx=0,
00527            CvSVMParams _params=CvSVMParams() );
00528 
00529     virtual bool train( const CvMat* _train_data, const CvMat* _responses,
00530                         const CvMat* _var_idx=0, const CvMat* _sample_idx=0,
00531                         CvSVMParams _params=CvSVMParams() );
00532     
00533     virtual bool train_auto( const CvMat* _train_data, const CvMat* _responses,
00534         const CvMat* _var_idx, const CvMat* _sample_idx, CvSVMParams _params,
00535         int k_fold = 10,
00536         CvParamGrid C_grid      = get_default_grid(CvSVM::C),
00537         CvParamGrid gamma_grid  = get_default_grid(CvSVM::GAMMA),
00538         CvParamGrid p_grid      = get_default_grid(CvSVM::P),
00539         CvParamGrid nu_grid     = get_default_grid(CvSVM::NU),
00540         CvParamGrid coef_grid   = get_default_grid(CvSVM::COEF),
00541         CvParamGrid degree_grid = get_default_grid(CvSVM::DEGREE) );
00542 
00543     virtual float predict( const CvMat* _sample, bool returnDFVal=false ) const;
00544 
00545 #ifndef SWIG
00546     CvSVM( const cv::Mat& _train_data, const cv::Mat& _responses,

00579     virtual bool set_params( const CvSVMParams& _params );

00581                     const void* _responses, double Cp, double Cn,
00582                     CvMemStorage* _storage, double* alpha, double& rho );
00583     virtual bool do_train( int svm_type, int sample_count, int var_count, const float** samples,
00584                     const CvMat* _responses, CvMemStorage* _storage, double* alpha );
00585     virtual void create_kernel();
00586     virtual void create_solver();
00587 
00588     virtual float predict( const float* row_sample, int row_len, bool returnDFVal=false ) const;
00589 
00590     virtual void write_params( CvFileStorage* fs ) const;
00591     virtual void read_params( CvFileStorage* fs, CvFileNode* node );
00592 
00593     CvSVMParams params;
00594     CvMat* class_labels;

00596     float** sv;
00597     int sv_total;

00622                 const CvMat* _probs=0, const CvMat* _weights=0, const CvMat* _means=0, const CvMat** _covs=0 ) :
00623                 nclusters(_nclusters), cov_mat_type(_cov_mat_type), start_step(_start_step),
00624                 probs(_probs), weights(_weights), means(_means), covs(_covs), term_crit(_term_crit)
00625     {}

00631     const CvMat* weights;
00632     const CvMat* means;
00633     const CvMat** covs;
00634     CvTermCriteria term_crit;
00635 };

00706 /****************************************************************************************\

00709 struct CvPair16u32s
00710 {
00711     unsigned short* u;
00712     int* i;

00715 
00716 #define CV_DTREE_CAT_DIR(idx,subset) \
00717     (2*((subset[(idx)>>5]&(1 << ((idx) & 31)))==0)-1)
00718 
00719 struct CvDTreeSplit
00720 {
00721     int var_idx;
00722     int condensed_idx;
00723     int inversed;
00724     float quality;
00725     CvDTreeSplit* next;
00726     union
00727     {
00728         int subset[2];
00729         struct
00730         {
00731             float c;
00732             int split_point;
00733         }
00734         ord;
00735     };
00736 };
00737 
00738 
00739 struct CvDTreeNode
00740 {
00741     int class_idx;
00742     int Tn;
00743     double value;
00744 
00745     CvDTreeNode* parent;
00746     CvDTreeNode* left;
00747     CvDTreeNode* right;
00748 
00749     CvDTreeSplit* split;
00750 
00751     int sample_count;
00752     int depth;
00753     int* num_valid;
00754     int offset;
00755     int buf_idx;
00756     double maxlr;
00757 
00758     // global pruning data
00759     int complexity;
00760     double alpha;
00761     double node_risk, tree_risk, tree_error;
00762 
00763     // cross-validation pruning data
00764     int* cv_Tn;
00765     double* cv_node_risk;
00766     double* cv_node_error;
00767 
00768     int get_num_valid(int vi) { return num_valid ? num_valid[vi] : sample_count; }
00769     void set_num_valid(int vi, int n) { if( num_valid ) num_valid[vi] = n; }
00770 };

00773 struct CV_EXPORTS CvDTreeParams
00774 {
00775     int   max_categories;
00776     int   max_depth;
00777     int   min_sample_count;
00778     int   cv_folds;
00779     bool  use_surrogates;
00780     bool  use_1se_rule;
00781     bool  truncate_pruned_tree;
00782     float regression_accuracy;
00783     const float* priors;
00784 
00785     CvDTreeParams() : max_categories(10), max_depth(INT_MAX), min_sample_count(10),
00786         cv_folds(10), use_surrogates(true), use_1se_rule(true),
00787         truncate_pruned_tree(true), regression_accuracy(0.01f), priors(0)
00788     {}
00789 
00790     CvDTreeParams( int _max_depth, int _min_sample_count,
00791                    float _regression_accuracy, bool _use_surrogates,
00792                    int _max_categories, int _cv_folds,
00793                    bool _use_1se_rule, bool _truncate_pruned_tree,
00794                    const float* _priors ) :
00795         max_categories(_max_categories), max_depth(_max_depth),
00796         min_sample_count(_min_sample_count), cv_folds (_cv_folds),
00797         use_surrogates(_use_surrogates), use_1se_rule(_use_1se_rule),
00798         truncate_pruned_tree(_truncate_pruned_tree),
00799         regression_accuracy(_regression_accuracy),
00800         priors(_priors)
00801     {}
00802 };

01052 struct CV_EXPORTS CvRTParams : public CvDTreeParams
01053 {
01054     //Parameters for the forest
01055     bool calc_var_importance; // true <=> RF processes variable importance
01056     int nactive_vars;
01057     CvTermCriteria term_crit;
01058 
01059     CvRTParams() : CvDTreeParams( 5, 10, 0, false, 10, 0, false, false, 0 ),
01060         calc_var_importance(false), nactive_vars(0)
01061     {
01062         term_crit = cvTermCriteria( CV_TERMCRIT_ITER+CV_TERMCRIT_EPS, 50, 0.1 );
01063     }
01064 
01065     CvRTParams( int _max_depth, int _min_sample_count,
01066                 float _regression_accuracy, bool _use_surrogates,
01067                 int _max_categories, const float* _priors, bool _calc_var_importance,
01068                 int _nactive_vars, int max_num_of_trees_in_the_forest,
01069                 float forest_accuracy, int termcrit_type ) :
01070         CvDTreeParams( _max_depth, _min_sample_count, _regression_accuracy,
01071                        _use_surrogates, _max_categories, 0,
01072                        false, false, _priors ),
01073         calc_var_importance(_calc_var_importance),
01074         nactive_vars(_nactive_vars)
01075     {
01076         term_crit = cvTermCriteria(termcrit_type,
01077             max_num_of_trees_in_the_forest, forest_accuracy);
01078     }
01079 };
01080

01115     virtual float get_train_error();    
01116 
01117     virtual void read( CvFileStorage* fs, CvFileNode* node );
01118     virtual void write( CvFileStorage* fs, const char* name ) const;
01119 
01120     CvMat* get_active_var_mask();
01121     CvRNG* get_rng();
01122 
01123     int get_tree_count() const;
01124     CvForestTree* get_tree(int i) const;
01125 
01126 protected:
01127 
01128     virtual bool grow_forest( const CvTermCriteria term_crit );
01129 
01130     // array of the trees of the forest
01131     CvForestTree** trees;
01132     CvDTreeTrainData* data;
01133     int ntrees;
01134     int nclasses;
01135     double oob_error;
01136     CvMat* var_importance;
01137     int nsamples;
01138 
01139     CvRNG rng;
01140     CvMat* active_var_mask;
01141 };

01393 class CV_EXPORTS CvANN_MLP : public CvStatModel
01394 {
01395 public:
01396     CvANN_MLP();
01397     CvANN_MLP( const CvMat* _layer_sizes,
01398                int _activ_func=SIGMOID_SYM,
01399                double _f_param1=0, double _f_param2=0 );
01400 
01401     virtual ~CvANN_MLP();
01402 
01403     virtual void create( const CvMat* _layer_sizes,
01404                          int _activ_func=SIGMOID_SYM,
01405                          double _f_param1=0, double _f_param2=0 );
01406     
01407     virtual int train( const CvMat* _inputs, const CvMat* _outputs,
01408                        const CvMat* _sample_weights, const CvMat* _sample_idx=0,
01409                        CvANN_MLP_TrainParams _params = CvANN_MLP_TrainParams(),
01410                        int flags=0 );
01411     virtual float predict( const CvMat* _inputs, CvMat* _outputs ) const;
01412     
01413 #ifndef SWIG
01414     CvANN_MLP( const cv::Mat& _layer_sizes,
01415               int _activ_func=SIGMOID_SYM,
01416               double _f_param1=0, double _f_param2=0 );
01417     
01418     virtual void create( const cv::Mat& _layer_sizes,
01419                         int _activ_func=SIGMOID_SYM,
01420                         double _f_param1=0, double _f_param2=0 );    
01421     
01422     virtual int train( const cv::Mat& _inputs, const cv::Mat& _outputs,
01423                       const cv::Mat& _sample_weights, const cv::Mat& _sample_idx=cv::Mat(),
01424                       CvANN_MLP_TrainParams _params = CvANN_MLP_TrainParams(),
01425                       int flags=0 );    
01426     
01427     virtual float predict( const cv::Mat& _inputs, cv::Mat& _outputs ) const;
01428 #endif
01429     
01430     virtual void clear();
01431 
01432     // possible activation functions
01433     enum { IDENTITY = 0, SIGMOID_SYM = 1, GAUSSIAN = 2 };
01434 
01435     // available training flags
01436     enum { UPDATE_WEIGHTS = 1, NO_INPUT_SCALE = 2, NO_OUTPUT_SCALE = 4 };
01437 
01438     virtual void read( CvFileStorage* fs, CvFileNode* node );
01439     virtual void write( CvFileStorage* storage, const char* name ) const;
01440 
01441     int get_layer_count() { return layer_sizes ? layer_sizes->cols : 0; }
01442     const CvMat* get_layer_sizes() { return layer_sizes; }
01443     double* get_weights(int layer)
01444     {
01445         return layer_sizes && weights &&
01446             (unsigned)layer <= (unsigned)layer_sizes->cols ? weights[layer] : 0;
01447     }
01448 
01449 protected:
01450 
01451     virtual bool prepare_to_train( const CvMat* _inputs, const CvMat* _outputs,
01452             const CvMat* _sample_weights, const CvMat* _sample_idx,
01453             CvVectors* _ivecs, CvVectors* _ovecs, double** _sw, int _flags );
01454 
01455     // sequential random backpropagation
01456     virtual int train_backprop( CvVectors _ivecs, CvVectors _ovecs, const double* _sw );
01457 
01458     // RPROP algorithm
01459     virtual int train_rprop( CvVectors _ivecs, CvVectors _ovecs, const double* _sw );
01460 
01461     virtual void calc_activ_func( CvMat* xf, const double* bias ) const;
01462     virtual void calc_activ_func_deriv( CvMat* xf, CvMat* deriv, const double* bias ) const;
01463     virtual void set_activ_func( int _activ_func=SIGMOID_SYM,
01464                                  double _f_param1=0, double _f_param2=0 );
01465     virtual void init_weights();
01466     virtual void scale_input( const CvMat* _src, CvMat* _dst ) const;
01467     virtual void scale_output( const CvMat* _src, CvMat* _dst ) const;
01468     virtual void calc_input_scale( const CvVectors* vecs, int flags );
01469     virtual void calc_output_scale( const CvVectors* vecs, int flags );
01470 
01471     virtual void write_params( CvFileStorage* fs ) const;
01472     virtual void read_params( CvFileStorage* fs, CvFileNode* node );
01473 
01474     CvMat* layer_sizes;
01475     CvMat* wbuf;
01476     CvMat* sample_weights;
01477     double** weights;
01478     double f_param1, f_param2;
01479     double min_val, max_val, min_val1, max_val1;
01480     int activ_func;
01481     int max_count, max_buf_sz;
01482     CvANN_MLP_TrainParams params;
01483     CvRNG rng;
01484 };

01486 #if 0
01487 /****************************************************************************************\
01488 *                            Convolutional Neural Network                                *
01489 \****************************************************************************************/
01490 typedef struct CvCNNLayer CvCNNLayer;
01491 typedef struct CvCNNetwork CvCNNetwork;
01492 
01493 #define CV_CNN_LEARN_RATE_DECREASE_HYPERBOLICALLY  1
01494 #define CV_CNN_LEARN_RATE_DECREASE_SQRT_INV        2
01495 #define CV_CNN_LEARN_RATE_DECREASE_LOG_INV         3
01496 
01497 #define CV_CNN_GRAD_ESTIM_RANDOM        0
01498 #define CV_CNN_GRAD_ESTIM_BY_WORST_IMG  1
01499 
01500 #define ICV_CNN_LAYER                0x55550000
01501 #define ICV_CNN_CONVOLUTION_LAYER    0x00001111
01502 #define ICV_CNN_SUBSAMPLING_LAYER    0x00002222
01503 #define ICV_CNN_FULLCONNECT_LAYER    0x00003333
01504 
01505 #define ICV_IS_CNN_LAYER( layer )                                          \
01506     ( ((layer) != NULL) && ((((CvCNNLayer*)(layer))->flags & CV_MAGIC_MASK)\
01507         == ICV_CNN_LAYER ))
01508 
01509 #define ICV_IS_CNN_CONVOLUTION_LAYER( layer )                              \
01510     ( (ICV_IS_CNN_LAYER( layer )) && (((CvCNNLayer*) (layer))->flags       \
01511         & ~CV_MAGIC_MASK) == ICV_CNN_CONVOLUTION_LAYER )
01512 
01513 #define ICV_IS_CNN_SUBSAMPLING_LAYER( layer )                              \
01514     ( (ICV_IS_CNN_LAYER( layer )) && (((CvCNNLayer*) (layer))->flags       \
01515         & ~CV_MAGIC_MASK) == ICV_CNN_SUBSAMPLING_LAYER )
01516 
01517 #define ICV_IS_CNN_FULLCONNECT_LAYER( layer )                              \
01518     ( (ICV_IS_CNN_LAYER( layer )) && (((CvCNNLayer*) (layer))->flags       \
01519         & ~CV_MAGIC_MASK) == ICV_CNN_FULLCONNECT_LAYER )
01520 
01521 typedef void (CV_CDECL *CvCNNLayerForward)
01522     ( CvCNNLayer* layer, const CvMat* input, CvMat* output );
01523 
01524 typedef void (CV_CDECL *CvCNNLayerBackward)
01525     ( CvCNNLayer* layer, int t, const CvMat* X, const CvMat* dE_dY, CvMat* dE_dX );
01526 
01527 typedef void (CV_CDECL *CvCNNLayerRelease)
01528     (CvCNNLayer** layer);
01529 
01530 typedef void (CV_CDECL *CvCNNetworkAddLayer)
01531     (CvCNNetwork* network, CvCNNLayer* layer);
01532 
01533 typedef void (CV_CDECL *CvCNNetworkRelease)
01534     (CvCNNetwork** network);
01535 
01536 #define CV_CNN_LAYER_FIELDS()           \
01537     /* Indicator of the layer's type */ \
01538     int flags;                          \
01539                                         \
01540     /* Number of input images */        \
01541     int n_input_planes;                 \
01542     /* Height of each input image */    \
01543     int input_height;                   \
01544     /* Width of each input image */     \
01545     int input_width;                    \
01546                                         \
01547     /* Number of output images */       \
01548     int n_output_planes;                \
01549     /* Height of each output image */   \
01550     int output_height;                  \
01551     /* Width of each output image */    \
01552     int output_width;                   \
01553                                         \
01554     /* Learning rate at the first iteration */                      \
01555     float init_learn_rate;                                          \
01556     /* Dynamics of learning rate decreasing */                      \
01557     int learn_rate_decrease_type;                                   \
01558     /* Trainable weights of the layer (including bias) */           \
01559     /* i-th row is a set of weights of the i-th output plane */     \
01560     CvMat* weights;                                                 \
01561                                                                     \
01562     CvCNNLayerForward  forward;                                     \
01563     CvCNNLayerBackward backward;                                    \
01564     CvCNNLayerRelease  release;                                     \
01565     /* Pointers to the previous and next layers in the network */   \
01566     CvCNNLayer* prev_layer;                                         \
01567     CvCNNLayer* next_layer
01568 
01569 typedef struct CvCNNLayer
01570 {
01571     CV_CNN_LAYER_FIELDS();
01572 }CvCNNLayer;
01573 
01574 typedef struct CvCNNConvolutionLayer
01575 {
01576     CV_CNN_LAYER_FIELDS();
01577     // Kernel size (height and width) for convolution.
01578     int K;
01579     // connections matrix, (i,j)-th element is 1 iff there is a connection between
01580     // i-th plane of the current layer and j-th plane of the previous layer;
01581     // (i,j)-th element is equal to 0 otherwise
01582     CvMat *connect_mask;
01583     // value of the learning rate for updating weights at the first iteration
01584 }CvCNNConvolutionLayer;
01585 
01586 typedef struct CvCNNSubSamplingLayer
01587 {
01588     CV_CNN_LAYER_FIELDS();
01589     // ratio between the heights (or widths - ratios are supposed to be equal)
01590     // of the input and output planes
01591     int sub_samp_scale;
01592     // amplitude of sigmoid activation function
01593     float a;
01594     // scale parameter of sigmoid activation function
01595     float s;
01596     // exp2ssumWX = exp(2<s>*(bias+w*(x1+...+x4))), where x1,...x4 are some elements of X
01597     // - is the vector used in computing of the activation function in backward
01598     CvMat* exp2ssumWX;
01599     // (x1+x2+x3+x4), where x1,...x4 are some elements of X
01600     // - is the vector used in computing of the activation function in backward
01601     CvMat* sumX;
01602 }CvCNNSubSamplingLayer;
01603 
01604 // Structure of the last layer.
01605 typedef struct CvCNNFullConnectLayer
01606 {
01607     CV_CNN_LAYER_FIELDS();
01608     // amplitude of sigmoid activation function
01609     float a;
01610     // scale parameter of sigmoid activation function
01611     float s;
01612     // exp2ssumWX = exp(2*<s>*(W*X)) - is the vector used in computing of the
01613     // activation function and it's derivative by the formulae
01614     // activ.func. = <a>(exp(2<s>WX)-1)/(exp(2<s>WX)+1) == <a> - 2<a>/(<exp2ssumWX> + 1)
01615     // (activ.func.)' = 4<a><s>exp(2<s>WX)/(exp(2<s>WX)+1)^2
01616     CvMat* exp2ssumWX;
01617 }CvCNNFullConnectLayer;
01618 
01619 typedef struct CvCNNetwork
01620 {
01621     int n_layers;
01622     CvCNNLayer* layers;
01623     CvCNNetworkAddLayer add_layer;
01624     CvCNNetworkRelease release;
01625 }CvCNNetwork;
01626 
01627 typedef struct CvCNNStatModel
01628 {
01629     CV_STAT_MODEL_FIELDS();
01630     CvCNNetwork* network;
01631     // etalons are allocated as rows, the i-th etalon has label cls_labeles[i]
01632     CvMat* etalons;
01633     // classes labels
01634     CvMat* cls_labels;
01635 }CvCNNStatModel;
01636 
01637 typedef struct CvCNNStatModelParams
01638 {
01639     CV_STAT_MODEL_PARAM_FIELDS();
01640     // network must be created by the functions cvCreateCNNetwork and <add_layer>
01641     CvCNNetwork* network;
01642     CvMat* etalons;
01643     // termination criteria
01644     int max_iter;
01645     int start_iter;
01646     int grad_estim_type;
01647 }CvCNNStatModelParams;

01869     // use these methods to assign CV_VAR_CATEGORICAL type for categorical variable
01870     // with numerical labels; in the other cases var types are correctly determined automatically
01871     void set_var_types( const char* str );  // str examples:
01872                                             // "ord[0-17],cat[18]", "ord[0,2,4,10-12], cat[1,3,5-9,13,14]",
